meanings.definition: The position or job of a curator.
meanings.sent1: In museums, curatorships involve managing collections and organizing exhibitions.
meanings.sent2: She was offered a curatorship at the art gallery due to her expertise in art history.
meanings.sent3: The curatorship of the zoo was so busy that the curator had to juggle feeding times for the animals.
meanings.sent4: Taking on the curatorship of the historical artifacts felt like being the guardian of precious memories.
meanings.sent5: The curatorship of the library required meticulous attention to detail and a passion for books.

meanings.definition: The responsibilities or duties of a curator.
meanings.sent1: Curatorships involve preserving cultural heritage and educating the public.
meanings.sent2: The curatorships at the museum include conducting research and acquiring new pieces for the collection.
meanings.sent3: The curatorship of the art gallery turned into a delightful adventure of discovering hidden talents.
meanings.sent4: Her dedication to the curatorship of the botanical garden bloomed like the flowers under her care.
meanings.sent5: The curatorship of the historical society required a deep respect for the past and a vision for the future.
